document_data.name: ''Hate of the Cobra''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Hate of the Cobra''''' was a [[holy book]] created by a [[Set]]ite priest sometime around the 10{{th}} or 11{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite web/Hate of the Cobra}}
document_data.Description: ''Hate of the Cobra'' was a collection of papyrus pages bound together and attached to a sun-bleached [[human]] arm bone. The pages were wrapped in the black and green skin of a [[fiendish]] [[snake]], and held together by thick leather straps.
document_data.Contents:
The first page of the collection pictured a coiled [[cobra]] symbol, and a preface written in [[Mulhorandi language|Mulhorandi]] explaining that the reader has in their hands a collection of spells brought together by the priests of [[Set]]. In addition to spell descriptions, the remaining pages contained several illustrations in traditional [[Mulhorandi]] style.

The ''Hate'' described six spells, listed below, as well as prayers used to call upon a [[divine minion]].

''[[faith healing]]'' • ''[[snakebite]]'' • ''[[incarnation of evil]]'' • ''[[spell phylactery]]'' • ''[[undeath after death]]'' • ''[[stormrage]]''
document_data.History:
''Hate of the Cobra'' was a collection of spells compiled by the Setite [[priest]] [[Aap Nura]], deemed appropriate to the worship of evil gods. After a successful career among his [[church of Set|church]], [[Set]] turned Aap into a divine minion as a reward for his service. The book subsequently passed among many hands, within the church first then lost after attacks from other churches.

During the {{YearlinkName|1300}}, the book resurfaced and was offered by a priest to a divine minion of Set as payment for services. Since that time the deity had the tome guarded by his minions, tasking them to lending it to his mortal followers so the spells could remain in use among his church—any worshiper knowing the prayers to summon a minion could to so to request the permission to study the spells found in the Hate of the Cobra.

''Circa'' [[1370 DR]], the book was in possession of [[Thah Rahalar]], a corrupted [[Hound archon]] of [[Anubis]] who became a minion of Set.
